passage_text: Target is one of the retail stores which will be extending their opening hours the days before Christmas. The store will open the following hours leading up to Christmas: 1  Sunday, December 21: Target will be open from 8:00 AM to 11:00 PM. 2  Monday, December 22: Target will be open from 8:00 AM to 12:00 AM.

Here are some of the chain stores open on New Year’s Day 2015 and their hours. When in doubt, call your store location for details. Best Buy: Stores will open at 9 a.m. on Thursday, but many will close earlier than normal on New Year’s Day as well as New Year’s Eve, at 7 p.m. Check your store for hours. [ Store locator ]. Big Lots: Stores will be open New Year’s Day, many of them during regular hours. Check your store location for changes. [ Store locator ]. B.J.’s: Stores will be open Thursday from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. [ Store locator ]. Costco: Stores close early New Year’s Eve, at 6 p.m., and will remain closed Jan. 1.

A: Most Target stores are open during their normal business hours on holidays, from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Monday through Saturday or 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Sundays. This depends on which holiday it is and the location of the store. Many Target stores open earlier on some holidays but are closed on other holidays.

The stores are open the other 363 days of the year, although there are days when hours will vary from the typical schedule. For example, Target is open limited hours on Thanksgiving Day, and has extended hours on various days during the Christmas holiday shopping season.

[ Store Locator ]. Target: Stores will be open during regular business hours on New Year's Day but close early on New Year’s Eye at 8 p.m. or 9 p.m. depending on location. [ Store Locator ]. Toys R Us: Stores will be closed on New Year's Day and have limited hours on New Year’s Eve.

Quick Answer. Most Target stores are open during their normal business hours on holidays, from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Monday through Saturday or 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Sundays. This depends on which holiday it is and the location of the store.

Target (TGT) will extend shopping hours at more than half of its 1,800 stores, as it gears up for the holiday shopping season and seeks to snag more shoppers. The new hours will keep stores open until 11 p.m. or midnight and until 10 p.m. or 11 p.m. on Sundays, The Wall Street Journal reports.
